meanings.definition: Tending to give orders in an authoritative manner.
meanings.sent1: She is the bossier sister, always telling us what to do.
meanings.sent2: The teacher became bossier as the students grew more unruly.
meanings.sent3: The bossier cat decided it was time for dinner and meowed loudly.
meanings.sent4: The bossier clouds commanded the sky, bringing a storm with their dark presence.
meanings.sent5: His bossier tone made it clear who was in charge of the project.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'boss', meaning more boss-like or more in charge.
meanings.sent1: The new manager was even bossier than the previous one.
meanings.sent2: She felt bossier than ever after successfully leading the team.
meanings.sent3: The bossier puppy barked orders to the older dogs in the park.
meanings.sent4: The bossier mountain stood tall among the others, asserting its dominance.
meanings.sent5: His bossier attitude made him a natural leader in the group.

meanings.definition: A city in Louisiana, United States.
meanings.sent1: I visited Bossier last summer and enjoyed the local cuisine.
meanings.sent2: Bossier is known for its vibrant culture and friendly residents.
meanings.sent3: The Bossier sign welcomed travelers with its bright lights and warm glow.
meanings.sent4: In the distance, Bossier shimmered under the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The streets of Bossier bustled with activity during the festival.
